title: 'No intention to ... ': MHA offers big clarification on Chandigarh bill; move after political row
content: The Union home ministry clarified that the central government has no plans to introduce a bill altering Chandigarh's governance or administrative structure in the upcoming Parliament session. This statement followed a political controversy over a proposal to bring Chandigarh under Article 240 of the Constitution, which had sparked concerns about Punjab's rights over the city.

title: Explained: How new labour laws may cut take-home salary; raise PF & gratuity contributions
content: New labour codes effective November 21, 2025, mandate basic salary at 50% of CTC, potentially lowering take-home pay as retirement contributions rise. These unified laws aim to simplify compliance and boost worker safeguards. Expect higher provident fund and gratuity payments, impacting immediate earnings while enhancing long-term retirement security for employees.

title: Bengaluru shocker: Pilot 'sexually assaults' cabin crew member at hotel; booked
content: A case has been filed against a chartered flight pilot for allegedly sexually assaulting a 26-year-old cabin crew member in Bengaluru. The victim, who is from Hyderabad, reported the incident at Begumpet Police Station, leading to a 'Zero FIR' being registered. The case has since been transferred to Bengaluru for further investigation.

title: From Article 370 to Pegasus: Justice Kant set to take oath as CJI tomorrow; key cases
content: Justice Surya Kant, a distinguished judge, is set to become India's 53rd Chief Justice on Monday, succeeding Justice BR Gavai. With a tenure extending until February 2027, Justice Kant's career is marked by significant rulings on Article 370, sedition law, and Pegasus spyware. His contributions also span electoral transparency and gender justice within the legal fraternity.

title: US arrests tech company CTO and three others for selling Nvidia's banned chips to China
content: Four individuals, including two American citizens and two PRC nationals residing in the U.S., have been charged with illegally exporting advanced Nvidia GPUs to China. The conspiracy involved falsifying paperwork and using a shell company to transship the sensitive technology, which has AI and military applications. The scheme aimed to circumvent U.S. export controls, with over $3.

title: Relief for Indian-origin families: Canada to overhaul citizenship-by-descent rules; check details
content: Canada's Citizenship Act is undergoing a significant overhaul with Bill C-3, poised to benefit thousands of Indian-origin families. This landmark legislation abolishes the "second-generation cut-off," restoring citizenship to those previously excluded and establishing a "substantial connection test" for future generations born abroad.  The law, awaiting its effective date, promises greater fairness and inclusivity for Canadian families.

title: 'Used as example of under-performer': Peers flag humiliation; Delhi student suicide case deepens
content: Classmates of a 16-year-old student who died by suicide have alleged he was repeatedly humiliated by teachers at St Columba's School. They claim his suicidal thoughts were dismissed by the school counsellor. Protests continue, demanding justice and a transparent investigation into the alleged harassment.

title: Richest tech leaders: Google’s Larry Page now ahead of Jeff Bezos
content: Google's Larry Page and Sergey Brin have surged into the top 5 richest globally, propelled by the success of their Gemini 3 AI model. Page now ranks third, surpassing Jeff Bezos, while Brin secured the fifth spot, overtaking Mark Zuckerberg. This rapid ascent underscores the significant impact of the AI boom on tech billionaire wealth, showcasing extreme market volatility.

title: Ladakh violence: SC to hear plea against Sonam Wangchuk's detention on Nov 24
content: Sonam Wangchuk's wife challenges his detention under the NSA in the Supreme Court, calling it illegal and a violation of fundamental rights. The plea argues his arrest is based on stale allegations and aims to silence dissent, not address security. Wangchuk's wife also appealed to the President, alleging a 'witch-hunt'.

title: 'India backs early end to conflict': Jaishankar speaks to Ukraine counterpart
content: India's External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar spoke with his Ukrainian counterpart, reiterating New Delhi's call for an immediate end to the conflict and lasting peace. This comes amid complex developments, including a US proposal for peace and internal challenges faced by Ukraine. The conversation highlighted India's consistent diplomatic stance on the ongoing crisis.

title: 'Mazak bana rakha hai Test cricket ko': Pant's fiery message for Team IND star - watch
content: Stand-in captain Rishabh Pant's frustration was evident on Day 2 as India struggled against South Africa. Stump-mic recordings captured Pant urging his bowlers and fielders to maintain urgency and adhere to the over-rate timer, highlighting India's growing pressure.  Despite the team's efforts, South Africa's lower middle order continued to frustrate the hosts.

title: $1 trillion squad: Musk, Zuckerberg, Pichai, and fellow billionaires break the internet
content: A viral AI-generated image of tech titans like Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg in a parking lot has captivated the internet. Dubbed the '$1 trillion squad,' the photo's cinematic style and the juxtaposition with a cheap motel room in a sequel image fueled a massive meme storm, reflecting 2025's AI-dominated landscape and the immense cultural power of tech leaders.

title: TVK resumes poll campaign: Vijay challenges SIR rollout; targets DMK for 'loot' in TN
content: Tamilaga Vettri Kazhgam chief Vijay resumed his poll campaign in Tamil Nadu, challenging the Election Commission's Special Intensive Revision and criticizing the MK Stalin government for "loot and dynasty politics." Vijay emphasized his party's focus on moving education to the state list and conducting a caste census, contrasting it with "empty promises" on NEET.

title: 'Won't shut down': Al-Falah University to worried parents amid ED probe, NAAC notice
content: Al-Falah University assures parents it won't close amid regulatory probes and financial investigations. The Enforcement Directorate is probing alleged fund diversion and financial irregularities, leading to the arrest of the group's chairman. The university addressed a NAAC notice regarding outdated accreditation on its website, calling it an oversight.

title: Stefon Diggs' lady love Cardi B raves about hospital stay after giving birth
content: Rapper Cardi B shared her positive hospital experience after giving birth. She praised the food and treatment, joking about getting pregnant again soon. Fans reacted to her comments online. Cardi B is preparing for her upcoming tour in February 2026. Her album 'Am I The Drama' was released on September 19.

title: 'Hand on shoulder, kiss on cheek': Gujarat cop named in teen's molestation complaint
content: A 19-year-old BBA student reported sexual harassment in a Vejalpur lift, leading to the identification of the accused as Inspector Barkat Chavda from the Gandhinagar control room. The student was kissed on the cheek by the man, who then exited on the sixth floor. Police have secured CCTV footage and are investigating the incident.

title: Smriti and Palash’s wedding: What’s the net worth of the power couple? - Find Out
content: Cricketer Smriti Mandhana and music composer Palash Muchhal are set to marry on November 23. Mandhana, a top earner with a BCCI Grade A contract and significant WPL income, has an estimated net worth of Rs 34 crore. Muchhal, a successful composer and director, is valued between Rs 20-41 crore.

title: ‘Don’t feel safe in Goa’: Russian DJ says 'rude cop abused us'
content: Two foreign women, a DJ and an actress, have alleged verbal abuse by Goa police personnel during a routine stop. The women claim a policeman used expletives and told them to "go to your country." This incident adds to a series of negative reports impacting Goa's tourism reputation.

title: Watch: PM Modi shares G20 highlights; calls discussions with leaders 'productive'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi described his G20 Summit participation in Johannesburg as fruitful, sharing key proposals on sustainable development, countering drug-terror nexus, and empowering African youth. He advocated for a global repository of traditional knowledge and a swift global health response team.

title: IIT Madras to offer free Machine Learning course in 2026; all you need to know
content: IIT Madras’ free 2026 ‘Introduction to Machine Learning’ course offers a concept-driven, maths-backed path into AI. Across 12 weeks, it revises probability and linear algebra, then moves through regression, SVMs, neural networks, trees, ensembles, clustering, graphical models and basic reinforcement learning. Designed for serious learners, it delivers IIT-level rigour online, with only the optional certificate being paid for learners everywhere.

title: Adorable! Smriti Mandhana’s viral dance with Palash Muchhal steals spotlight - Watch
content: Cricket star Smriti Mandhana and music director Palash Muchhal are celebrating their wedding with vibrant pre-wedding festivities, including a surprise coordinated dance. Their journey, which began in 2019, saw them navigate demanding careers while keeping their relationship private until a public acknowledgment in July 2024. A memorable proposal followed India's ODI World Cup win.

title: Sikar: 22 hospitalised, including 15 children after inhaling toxic fumes; probe under way
content: Fifteen children and seven adults were hospitalized in Sikar, Rajasthan, after inhaling toxic fumes near an industrial area. Preliminary investigations suggest the fumes originated from a furnace burning clothes. Authorities are investigating the incident, and affected children are reported to be in stable condition.

title: 'Will always be part of Punjab': Row over plan to bring Chandigarh under Article 240
content: The central government's move to bring Chandigarh under Article 240, similar to other Union Territories, has ignited strong opposition in Punjab. Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann vehemently protested, asserting Punjab's sole right over the city. This amendment, potentially delinking Chandigarh from Punjab's administration, is viewed as a significant political development, sparking renewed tensions.

title: Toxic smog chokes Delhi: Air quality turns 'severe' as AQI reading soars to 435
content: Delhi awoke to dense smog, with the average Air Quality Index at 381, placing it in the 'very poor' category despite GRAP-IV measures. Bawana recorded 'severe' pollution at 435. Authorities revised GRAP, shifting 'severe' AQI measures to Stage III, allowing work-from-home decisions for government and private offices.

title: Ciara on Russell Wilson: His maturity and 'fullness as a man' define their marriage
content: Singer Ciara revealed on the 'Angie Martinez IRL' podcast that her husband, Russell Wilson, despite being younger, acts as an emotional anchor due to his 'old soul' and maturity. She finds his grounded demeanor provides stability amidst NFL pressures and fame.  Ciara emphasized his 'fullness as a man' enriches their strong partnership.

title: From better digestion to relaxation: Why you should drink clove water at night
content: Drinking clove water at night is a beneficial habit. It aids digestion, reduces discomfort, and promotes relaxation. This traditional remedy supports the body's natural detoxification processes during sleep. It also offers anti-inflammatory benefits for overall health. Experts recommend consuming it before bedtime for optimal results. This simple practice can lead to better sleep and improved well-being.

title: Ashes: 'Two years ago you silenced India'- Shastri’s hard-hitting tribute to Travis Head
content: Travis Head delivered a career-defining innings in the Ashes opener at Perth, smashing a century off just 69 balls. His aggressive 123 off 83 guided Australia to a remarkable victory, leaving England captain Ben Stokes shellshocked. This performance reignited memories of his match-winning efforts against India in major finals.

title: ‘Tipu-Ipu ko maro’: Himanta backs dropping ‘Great’ from Akbar; row over NCERT move
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma backed NCERT's alleged removal of 'Great' from Akbar and Tipu Sultan's names, welcoming the change. While RSS leader Sunil Ambekar confirmed title removal, not historical figures, the move sparked political debate. Congress MP Imran Masood criticized it as rewriting history, while VHP spokesperson Vinod Bansal supported the revision, deeming Mughal glorification unacceptable.

title: Wedding day! Smriti Mandhana to get married today to Palash Muchhal: Inside her secret love story
content: Indian cricket icon Smriti Mandhana is set to marry music composer Palash Muchhal this Sunday in an intimate ceremony in her hometown. The couple, who kept their relationship private for years, publicly announced their engagement after India's ODI World Cup win. Muchhal's proposal at DY Patil Stadium and a tattoo of Mandhana's initials mark their journey towards formalizing their bond.

title: Smriti Mandhana set to tie the knot with Palash Muchhal today: All you need to know
content: Cricket sensation Smriti Mandhana is set to marry composer Palash Muchhal on November 23, 2025, in Sangli.  Their private wedding follows a triumphant World Cup campaign and a romantic proposal at DY Patil Stadium.  The couple, who kept their relationship private until July 2024, have successfully balanced demanding careers, showcasing a strong bond and mutual support.

title: Delhi blast: Accused doctors bought Russian weapon, freezer for explosives
content: Fresh revelations in the Jaish-e-Mohammed module bust in Faridabad expose a sophisticated weapons and explosives network. Dr. Muzammil purchased a Russian assault rifle for Rs 5 lakh, later recovered from Dr. Adeel's locker. Dr. Shaheen arranged for weapons and a freezer, with funds largely mobilized by her. The module's operational readiness and planning are highlighted by these discoveries.

title: Ind vs Sa: KL Rahul set to return as India’s ODI captain; Gill doubtful for T20Is as well
content: KL Rahul will captain India in the upcoming ODI series against South Africa, replacing Shubman Gill who is out with a serious neck injury. With vice-captain Shreyas Iyer also sidelined, Rahul steps in. Gill's recovery timeline is extended, raising doubts about his availability for the T20Is as well.

title: Uttarakhand on alert: 20kg explosives, 161 gelignite sticks found near Almora schools
content: A significant security alert was issued in Almora district after 161 gelignite sticks and over 20 kg of explosives were discovered near two schools. The discovery, made by children, has prompted a massive search operation involving dog squads and forensic teams to identify the source and purpose of the material.

title: Trump Jr, Bollywood line up for wedding of US baron’s daughter in Udaipur
content: US President Donald Trump Jr. joined celebrities like Jennifer Lopez and Justin Bieber in Udaipur for the wedding of US baron Rama Raju Mantena's daughter, Netra. The lavish event, held at Jag Mandir Island Palace, saw extensive security measures and performances by top artists, highlighting the Mantena family's significant connections.

title: Delhi school admissions 2026-27: Schedule for nursery, KG in private schools out
content: Delhi’s Directorate of Education has released the full schedule for Nursery, KG and Class 1 admissions in private unaided schools for 2026–27. Applications open on 4 December, with the first list on 23 January and final closure on 19 March. The circular details age limits, ₹25 registration fee cap, draw-of-lot rules and mandatory transparency measures for schools.

title: Gisele Bundchen says prioritising Tom Brady for years took personal toll
content: Supermodel Gisele Bündchen reflects on her marriage to Tom Brady, describing their split as a "death and rebirth." She details her shift from supporting his career to rediscovering her own dreams and personal fulfillment. Bündchen emphasizes that true success lies in authenticity and self-discovery, moving forward on her own terms.

title: Who was Harman Sidhu? All about the Punjabi singer who passed away in road accident
content: Tragic news as Punjabi singer Harman Sidhu has passed away at 37 following a fatal road accident. His vehicle collided head-on with a truck on the Mansa-Patiala road, resulting in his immediate death. Sidhu rose to fame with his hit song 'Paper Ya Pyar' and was known for his relatable tracks and down-to-earth nature.

title: 'Too much speed for narrow lane': Teen-driven car kills 7-year-old in Gurgaon
content: A seven-year-old boy was tragically killed after being struck and dragged by a speeding car driven by a 15-year-old in Gurgaon's Maruti Kunj. The incident occurred while the child was playing outside his home with his father. Police have registered a case of causing death by negligence and rash driving.

title: Ukraine peace plan row: Is Trump’s 28-point proposal actually Russia’s ‘wishlist’? What Rubio said
content: The US State Department has vehemently denied that a 28-point Ukraine peace plan is a "Russian wish list," despite claims from senators. Spokesman Tommy Pigott stated the plan was US-authored with input from both nations. Leaked details suggest the proposal reflects Russian demands, causing concern in Kyiv and Europe. President Trump has urged Ukraine's response.

title: Exclusive! Abhinav Tejrana - The Delhi boy ignored by DDCA is making waves for Goa
content: The 24-year-old top-order batter Abhinav Tejrana has set the Ranji Trophy on fire. Batting for Goa at No. 3, the Delhi-born cricketer has amassed 651 runs in eight innings, including a double century on first-class debut against Chandigarh. He has also smashed two centuries against Punjab and Saurashtra, and not to forget his match-saving unbeaten 73 against Karnataka.

title: 'Trusted orchestra': Army chief on Op Sindoor's 22-min, 9-target strike
content: Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi described Operation Sindoor as a "trusted orchestra" where forces destroyed nine terror targets in 22 minutes. He highlighted the operation's success, emphasizing the importance of pre-visualization and team trust in swift decision-making. Dwivedi also hinted at a potential "2.0 version" of the operation.

title: PM Modi holds talks with South African President Ramaphosa, discusses cooperation in trade, critical minerals
content: The discussions focused on further cooperation in trade, investment, mining, critical minerals, AI, Digital Public Infrastructure, skill development and food security

title: Seventh accused in Bengaluru ATM van robbery case arrested
content: The police had earlier arrested six persons involved in the heist and recovered a total of ₹6.2 crore from them.

title: Proposal on Chandigarh doesn’t alter administrative structure, no final decision yet: MHA
content: The Constitution (131 Amendment) Bill 2025 seeks to include the Union Territory of Chandigarh in Article 240 of the Constitution of India, in alignment with other Union Territories

title: Four pilgrims from Madhya Pradesh killed in road accident
content: According to the police, the van in which they were travelling hit a stationary lorry, leading to the ghastly incident

title: TVK chief Vijay accuses DMK of abandoning Annadurai’s ideals
content: This  limited-access, indoor meeting at Sunguvarchathiram in Kancheepuram district marked the first public engagement of Mr. Vijay nearly two months after 41 persons died in a stampede at a political rally he addressed at Karur.

title: AIADMK general council, executive committee to meet on December 10
content: The meeting assumes significance in the backdrop of expulsion of senior leader and Gobichettipalayam MLA K.A. Sengottiayan

title: Gelatin sticks found near school in Uttarakhand’s Almora, investigation underway
content: “Preliminary investigations have ruled out any terrorist links, and it appears that the explosives were left behind by a contractor during construction of a road,” say Almora Senior Superintendent of Police

title: White collar terror module: Haryana preacher pleads with police to collect rent from doctors
content: Maulvi Ishtiyaq’s name surfaced during the interrogation of Dr. Muzammil Ganaie, a key member of the 'white-collar' terror module arrested from the University

title: Tamil Nadu government announces police honours for poet Erode Tamilanban's funeral
content: A Tamil teacher at New College, Chennai, the Sahitya Akademi Award recipient was also a newsreader with Doordarshan

title: SC to hear on November 24 plea challenging climate activist Sonam Wangchuk's detention
content: The plea said the unfortunate events of violence in Leh on September 24 cannot be attributed to the actions or statements of Mr. Wangchuk in any manner

title: After Akhilesh's charge on voter deletions, Maurya predicts Opposition setbacks in Bengal, U.P.
content: Akhilesh had alleges that the BJP and the Election Commission were conspiring to delete more than 50,000 votes in assembly segments where the SP and the INDIA bloc had won during the 2024 Lok Sabha polls

title: Justice Surya Kant to take oath as 53rd Chief Justice of India on November 24
content: Justice Kant was appointed as the next CJI on October 30 and will remain in the post for nearly 15 months

title: Kejriwal, Harsimrat oppose bill allowing President to make legislation for Chandigarh directly
content: The BJP-led central government's attempt to eliminate Punjab's rights over Chandigarh through constitutional amendment is not part of a simple move, but a direct attack on Punjab's identity and constitutional rights, says AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal

title: Fire breaks out at district hospital in M.P.'s Betul; patients shifted to safety
content: Patients from the female ward and the paediatric ward were shifted to safer areas as a precaution. The hospital staff later started the process of moving them back to their respective wards, the officials said

title: Illegal cough syrup trade: U.P. Police book 12 medical store owners
content: A drug department probe found that more than 37 lakh bottles of codeine syrup worth around ₹57 crore were shown as sold through forged documents by over a dozen medical stores

title: Man accused of drug peddling shot on knee by police near Chidambaram
content: The accused had nine cases including five ganja cases pending against him in various police stations in Cuddalore, Mayiladuthurai and Chennai.

title: Delhi air quality remains 'very poor', AQI stands at 381
content: The minimum temperature settled at 14°C, 2.7 °C above the season's average, while the humidity was recorded at 86% at 8.30 a.m., as per IMD.

title: Tejas crash at Dubai Air Show: Tributes paid to Wing Commander Namansh Syal at Sulur Air Force Station
content: The Wing Commander was attached to IAF's No. 45 Squadron (Flying Daggers) based at Air Force Station, Sulur, one of the two Squadrons operating Light Compact Aircraft (LCA) HAL Tejas

title: Four militants arrested in Manipur
content: Security forces arrested an active cadre of the proscribed PREPAK (PRO) from Moreh Gate in Tengnoupal district on November 21, say police

title: Two BLOs suspended for negligence during SIR in UP's Bahraich
content: The Election Commission of India expressed strong displeasure, terming the conduct of both officials a violation of service rules

title: Pakistan Defence Minister Asif condoles Indian pilot's death in Dubai Air Show crash
content: The Minister sharing Pakistan Strategic Forum’s message noted that “Unfortunately the IAF pilot wasn’t able to eject & hasn’t survived the crash.”

title: YSRCP misleading public over VSP issue, says Minister
content: With the initiative of the Chandrababu Naidu government, the Centre had announced ₹11,400-crore package for the steel plant, says Srinivas

title: India offers ‘strong support’ to Brazil for COP30, says satisfied with many outcomes from summit
content: Though New Delhi expressed satisfaction with many decisions, it did not specifically call the COP30 a success in devising a policy aimed at preventing climate change issues

title: Parents write to V-C, seek clarity regarding future of their children studying at Al Falah University
content: Around 18 parents visited the university campus on Saturday and submitted the letter expressing concern over the future of the university

title: Tamil Nadu expands Naan Mudhalvan initiative to healthcare
content: As part of this new initiative, students will receive specialised training in communication skills and digital skills — two competencies increasingly critical in today’s clinical environments

title: BJP criticises T.N. Deputy CM Udhayanidhi Stalin for calling Sanskrit a ‘dead language’
content: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said that the DMK leader had “become synonymous with anarchy and division” and alleged that T.N. Deputy Chief Minister was “known for his hatred” for Hindus

title: Quarrying crisis in Tamil Nadu’s Uthiramerur leaves residents in distress
content: Wells have gone dry and dust forms a thick coat over nearly every surface in the once sylvan landscape of Uthiramerur in Kancheepuram; quarries and stone crushing units are slowly eroding quality of life and leaving the residents in a belt of 60 villages in distress. Deepa H. Ramakrishnan and Geetha Srimathi record the tragic transformation of Uthiramerur

title: Devotees barred from climbing Arunachala Hills in Tiruvannamalai for Maha Deepam festival
content: Officials say that the safety of climbers was taken into consideration as the terrain on the hills was still wet; this will be the second year to ban devotees from climbing the hills on Maha Deepam day

title: CAG urges trainee civil servants to play transformative role
content: The  Comptroller and Auditor General of India, Sanjay Murthy explained how data-driven governance enhances institutional accountability and improvement and underscored the need for strong institutional financial discipline and investment-readiness

title: Congress appoints Vinay Kumar as new Himachal PCC chief
content: The appointment had been held up for quite some time and the hill state did not have a Pradesh Congress Committee after the previous committee headed by Kuldeep Singh was dissolved on November 6 last year

title: In the name of the cow | Maharashtra’s cow vigilantes fuel fear among meat traders, cattle rearers
content: In a Mumbai chawl, a woman waits for her missing husband. In Nashik, a man is allegedly bludgeoned to death. In Ahilyanagar, a child ends his life after he is allegedly humiliated in a live-streamed video

title: CPI (Maoist) | The guns fall silent
content: The killing of Madvi Hidma, the elusive commander of the Central Military Commission of the Maoists, signals not just a tactical defeat of the insurgents but the effective collapse of the armed struggle that once threatened to engulf vast swathes of India’s forested heartland

title: Are e-KYC norms excluding MGNREGA workers? | Explained
content: Why is the Union government pushing e-KYC verification of workers who are employed under the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act? Was there no method of verification available before the e-KYC system? What is the National Mobile Monitoring System?

title: Kerala local body polls: Battle for the ballot a burden on the pocket
content: Though the State Election Commission has set a ceiling of ₹1.5 lakh as election expenses for candidates in district panchayats and Corporations, the real cost overshoots the limit by a huge margin. Parties bear a portion of the expenses, but the candidate has to shoulder the actual burden

title: Kerala local body polls: Munnar hopes for stability after a term of defections, power struggle
content: Grama panchayat sees five different presidents in the past five years. Though UDF won the poll in 2020 with 11 seats and LDF 10 seats, two of its members defected to the in 2022 bringing the panchayat under LDF control. The was followed by a series of defections and power struggle

title: "No Reason For Alarm": Scientist Punctures Scare Over Uranium In Breastmilk
content: In a reassuring statement that addresses concern over a study that found uranium in the breastmilk of lactating mothers in Bihar, a senior scientist and member of National Disaster Management Authority has said the study's findings pose no concern

title: Noam Chomsky Called Exchanges With Epstein "Valuable," New Emails Show
content: Noam Chomsky's long-questioned association with Jeffrey Epstein is again under scrutiny after congressional emails revealed the 96-year-old philosopher lauding his interactions with the convicted sex offender as "a most valuable experience."

title: Wife Of Maharashtra Minister's Key Aide Dies By Suicide Over 'Harassment'
content: Gauri Palve, wife of Anant Garje, a personal assistant to the state Animal Husbandry and Environment Minister Munde, was found hanging at her house in the Worli area on Saturday evening.

title: PM Modi Holds Bilateral Talks With South African President On Sidelines Of G20 Summit
content: South African President warmly welcomed PM Modi on Saturday as he arrived to attend the G20 Leaders' Summit at Nasrec in Johannesburg.

title: Uranium Found In Breast Milk In Several Bihar Districts, Study Shows
content: A recent study has revealed alarming levels of uranium (U238) in the breastmilk of lactating mothers across several districts in Bihar, raising serious health concerns for their infants.

title: Jamiat Chief Backs Al Falah University Amid Delhi Blast Probe, BJP Hits Out
content: Jamiat Ulema-e-Hind president Arshad Madani has courted controversy over his remarks in connection with the ongoing probe into the Delhi blast.

title: Usha Vance's "Mother Of 3" Response To Rumours Over Missing Wedding Ring
content: Rumours about the marriage of US Vice President JD Vance and Usha Vance circulated this week after photos of the Second Lady attending a public event without her wedding ring surfaced on social media.

title: Video: BJP Mocks Congress Over Karnataka Tussle With Parrot Fortune-Telling Act
content: BJP workers in Karnataka have adopted a satirical approach to mock the Congress government over the power-sharing tussle in the state.

title: Bengal Teacher Hospitalised, Family Claims Stress Due To SIR Duty
content: Amid the face-off between West Bengal's Mamata Banerjee government and the Election Commission over the suicides of two Booth Level Officers (BLO) during the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR), a BLO has been hospitalised in South 24 Parganas.

title: Upset Over Parents Not Giving Her Phone, Nagpur Teen Dies By Suicide
content: The girl, a Class 8 student, used to like playing games on mobile phones. When she asked her parents to buy one for her, they refused.

title: 'No Job, Money': Trump's Immigration Action Leaves 2 Lakh Ukrainians In Limbo
content: They are waiting for Donald Trump's administration to decide the fate of a humanitarian program that allowed some 260,000 people who fled the war in Ukraine to live and work in the US.

title: Man With Disability Thrashed, Urinated Upon By Relatives In Madhya Pradesh
content: The deeply disturbing video surfaced on social media from Madhya Pradesh's Raisen, triggering outrage as bystanders continued filming the atrocity but made no attempt to intervene.

title: "Punjab Comes First": State BJP Chief Picks His Side Amid Chandigarh Uproar
content: Amid the political uproar in Punjab over the Centre's move to bring Chandigarh under the President's direct control, Punjab BJP chief Sunil Jakhar has said Chandigarh is an "integral part of Punjab" and assured that the "confusion" will be resolved

title: India, Afghanistan Discuss Expanding Spice-Related Cooperation: Taliban Minister
content: Afghanistan's Minister of Industry and Commerce, Al-Haj Nooruddin Azizi, met members of the Spices Board of India during his ongoing five-day visit to New Delhi.

title: "Capital Snatch Conspiracy": Punjab Pushback To Centre's Chandigarh Move
content: A massive political row has erupted over the Centre's push to bring Chandigarh under the purview of Article 240 of the Constitution, which will empower the President to make regulations for the Union Territory directly

title: Harvard University Database Hacked In Latest Ivy League Cyberattacks
content: US colleges have been a hacker target for years, though Ivy League schools have been especially hard-hit in recent months.

title: Zelensky Can "Fight His Little Heart Out" If He Rejects Peace Plan: Trump
content: Trump, who has demonstrated low regard for Zelensky dating back to his first term, says he expects the Ukrainian leader to respond to his administration's new plan to end the war by next Thursday.

title: Techie Alleges Rs 48 Lakh Fraud Over Sex Treatment, Suffers Kidney Damage
content: A software engineer in Bengaluru filed a police complaint claiming that a self-styled healer cheated him of nearly Rs 48 lakh by selling extremely expensive and allegedly harmful medicines for treating sexual health issues.

title: Student leaders give a campus vibe for local body elections in Kerala
content: CPI(M) has fielded 48 leaders of Students Federation of India  in the polls while the Congress has found 79 candidates from the Kerala Students’ Union. MSF, the students’ union of the Indian Union Muslim League has fielded 47 leaders, while 14 from the All India Students’ Federation, the CPI’s student wing, are also in the fray

title: Tamil Nadu government finds itself in a tight corner over Code on Social Security
content: The concern expressed by activists and trade unionists, besides the State government, is that the present framework of welfare schemes for unorganised workers may get disturbed after implementation of the Labour Code

title: Had there been Operation Sindoor after 26/11, nobody would have dared to attack India: CM Fadnavis
content: Speaking at an event at the Gateway of India to mark the 17th anniversary of the 26/11 attack that is coming up, the Maharashtra CM says an attack on the city was an “attack on the sovereignty of the country”

title: Adversary making desperate attempts to disrupt peace: J&K L-G Manoj Sinha
content: He said the Army contributed in creating a conducive environment for sustainable peace and overall development of the J&K U.T. as well as the growth of our country

title: Congress appoints new DCC presidents
content: Congress appoints new District Congress Committee presidents, including five MLAs and five women, enhancing leadership across districts

title: Cong., AAP, Akalis oppose Chandigarh plan of Central govt.
content: The parties say Constitution amendment Bill planned for Parliament’s upcoming Winter Session is a ploy to snatch the city away from Punjab

title: Advocates’ bodies seek probe by High Court judge into killing of Maoists
content: APSAA and Bezawada Bar Association allege that Maoist leader Madvi Hidma was killed in a ‘fake encounter’; human rights leader calls it a ‘murder’

title: Shashi Tharoor praises Trump-Mamdani meet; BJP takes a jibe at Rahul Gandhi
content: The Congress MP, posting a video of the meeting on X, said once elections are over, learn to cooperate with each other in the common interests of the nation. In response, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla says once again Shashi Tharoor ‘reminds Congress to put India First not Parivar’

title: Kadamakudy shocker for Congress as candidate’s nomination gets rejected
content: The nomination papers filed by Elsy George was rejected after it was found that a person who had seconded her candidature was a voter outside the division

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) rebukes Congress, says they don’t need anybody’s permission on MNS alliance
content: Parties within the Maha Vikas Aghadi bloc are divided over allying with Raj Thackeray’s MNS in the upcoming local body election

title: Pune cops bust arms-making units in M.P. village; 47 detained
content: The raid was conducted by a 105-member team comprising personnel from the crime branch and officials of wireless, drone, surveillance, and cyber sections

title: Madhya Pradesh HC grants interim stay on action against ancestral house of Al-Falah group chairperson
content: The Mhow Cantonment Board issued a notice on November 19 to remove "unauthorised construction" at the ancestral house of Jawad Ahmed Siddiqui.

title: Nomination of transpersons to contest from women’s wards accepted
content: The candidatures of Amaya Prasad and Arunima M. Kurup, fielded by the UDF in Thiruvananthapuram and Alappuzha respectively, were approved by the respective returning officers on November 22, 2025, thus paving the way for them to contest the civic polls

title: West Bengal SIR will cause the largest disenfranchisement of voters in history: activists
content: Political analysts, activists say SIR being used as a tool to “reduce the electoral weight of the States where the BJP is not sure of its support”; claim it is a “backdoor entry” for the controversial NRC, CAA

title: Security in Srinagar improving, all measures in place to maintain peace: CRPF IG
content: The CRPF, along with the J&K Police, the Army and civil administration, is working jointly to ensure stability in the region, says Pawan Kumar Sharma

title: Watch: Sons, daughters and battle for political legacy: the Lalu Yadav family fallout
content: In this episode of Talking Politics, we will examine the gender angle in political parties with family legacies

title: Siddaramaiah meets Kharge on resolving impasse over Cabinet reshuffle, power sharing
content: There was no clarity on the outcome of the talks; Shivakumar too is expected to meet Kharge on Sunday

title: Verstappen wins Vegas GP, narrows F1 points gap
content: Max Verstappen claimed his second Las Vegas Grand Prix ahead of championship leader Lando Norris to keep his slim championship chances alive.

title: Manning makes Texas history after snagging TD
content: Arch Manning became the first Longhorns player to catch, throw and rush for a touchdown on a night in which he accounted for six scores.

title: Klay claps back at Morant's postgame trash talk
content: After their verbal confrontation following Saturday's game, the Mavericks' Klay Thompson ripped Ja Morant, saying the Grizzlies' star "has a lot to say all the time, especially for someone who rarely takes accountability."

title: Shanahan hopeful but admits Aiyuk case 'unusual'
content: Niners coach Kyle Shanahan alternated between offering insight and declining to provide specifics on wide receiver Brandon Aiyuk's status with the team, a situation that he characterized as "extremely unusual."

title: UAB: Player arrested after stabbing 2 teammates
content: A UAB football player was arrested after stabbing two of his teammates Saturday morning at the football facility ahead of the Blazers' home game against USF, a school spokesperson confirmed.

title: KSU's Klieman emotional, defiant after close loss
content: An emotional Chris Klieman said he was gutted after a 51-47 loss to No. 12 Utah, one of several close defeats the banged-up Wildcats have been dealt this season.

title: Haney becomes 3-division champ in dominant win
content: Devin Haney rolled to an emphatic win over Brian Norman Jr. to capture the WBO welterweight crown Saturday, giving him a title in his third division.

title: Vandy's Pavia makes Heisman case in career day
content: Diego Pavia threw for a career-high 484 yards and five touchdowns and No. 14 Vanderbilt beat Kentucky 45-17 Saturday to keep its CFP hopes alive.

title: Verstappen wins as Norris settles for 2nd; Piastri 4th
content: Lap-by-lap analysis shows how Max Verstappen claimed a dominant win to cut into Lando Norris' F1 title lead.

title: NC State's bizarre punt recovery and a salute to a surgeon headline college football Week 13 superlatives
content: A Wolfpack punter somehow recovered his own punt, which easily made this week's college football superlatives.

title: Final prep for NFL Week 12: We have sleepers, QB questions, trends to watch and more
content: Will the Browns lean on the run in Shedeur Sanders' first start? Will Eagles-Cowboys come down to Jalen Hurts? Is Michael Wilson startable in fantasy?

title: Chelsea pass Burnley test, but Barcelona and Arsenal await in a big week
content: Chelsea weren't at their best vs. Burnley and got an important win, but they will need a bit more when facing Barcelona and Arsenal next.

title: Liverpool ratings: Isak, Konaté get 3/10 in woeful Forest loss
content: Liverpool were thrashed at Anfield by Nottingham Forest, and they were poor at both ends of the pitch.

title: Videos show police search for Marshawn Kneeland before death
content: The Texas DPS released hours of video footage that details their search for Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland before he was found dead.

title: Buzz: A closer look at what to make of Bengals not activating Joe Burrow for Week 12
content: Joe Burrow won't be activated for Sunday against the Patriots, but Stephania Bell explains that there's reason to believe the Bengals QB remains on track to return on Thanksgiving.

title: Inside the art of blocking a kick in the NFL: 'They're game changers'
content: The league has seen an uptick in blocked kicks, and ESPN's NFL Nation shares how players have done it.

title: NBA first-month lessons: What we're hearing on all 30 teams
content: Tim Bontemps takes the pulse of the league on OKC's chase for 70 wins, the potential post-Trae Hawks and more first-month standout storylines.

title: Pete Alonso's three most aggressive suitors so far -- and a few other fits for the free agent first baseman
content: For a second straight winter, the Mets' franchise home run king is seeking a long-term deal. Where might he land?

title: Should the Tigers trade Tarik Skubal? We asked around MLB
content: Will the best pitcher in baseball be on the move this offseason? Those in the game offer their advice.

title: WNBA mock draft: There's a new No. 1 replacing Lauren Betts at the top
content: Four UCLA players, including Lauren Betts, are now projected first-round picks. But Spain's Awa Fam is No. 1.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern eye move for Vasco's Rayan
content: Bayern are reportedly looking to sign Vasco da Gama forward Rayan. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: NHL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, each team's quarter-season MVP
content: The Avalanche's reign atop the list continues, and the Blackhawks break into the top 10. Here's the full list.

title: Grading preseason bold predictions for all 32 NHL teams
content: Some of our wild takes from September don't look so wild anymore. Others are way off base. Here's an update.

title: Gotham rides series of magic moments to win NWSL championship

title: G20 summit: PM Modi calls for global fight against drug-terror nexus

title: 'Searching for videos of son': Tejas pilot Syal’s father reveals how he found about crash
content: (File Photo) Wg Cdr Namansh Syal, who lost his life in the Tejas fighter aircraft crash at the Dubai Airshow, on Saturday. (@IAF_MCC on X) Sanjeev Verma is a Senior Assistant Editor covering Himachal Pradesh for The Times of India. His journalism experience spans across multiple states, including Punjab and Haryana, in addition to covering the Punjab and Haryana High Court, after an initial stint in Delhi. He navigates the realms of politics, security, public policy, finance, industries and commerce, rural development, legal affairs, environment, defence services welfare, and NRI affairs, with a focus on investigative journalism.
